Tasks.Task Description: Gather detailed requirements for storage capacity, performance tiers, and redundancy. Identify the applications and workloads that will use Azure NetApp Files.
Design the storage architecture, including volume configurations, performance tiers, and integration with existing on-premises and Azure environments.
Request and enable the Azure NetApp Files service in the Azure portal. Ensure the subscription supports the service and is in a supported region.
Create a NetApp account in the Azure portal to manage Azure NetApp Files resources.
Set up a virtual network and subnet for Azure NetApp Files. Ensure proper network security group (NSG) rules are applied.
Create a capacity pool within the NetApp account to allocate storage capacity and performance tiers.
Create and configure volumes within the capacity pool. Define volume size, performance tier, and protocol (NFS or SMB).
Enable encryption for data at rest and configure access controls for volumes. Apply security best practices such as Active Directory integration for SMB volumes.
Set up backup policies and recovery options for Azure NetApp Files volumes. Ensure snapshots are configured for data protection.
Perform thorough testing of storage performance and connectivity. Validate throughput, latency, and failover scenarios.
Set up monitoring and alerting using Azure Monitor and NetApp tools. Configure alerts for storage capacity, performance metrics, and connectivity issues.
Document the storage architecture, configurations, and operational procedures. Provide training for the operations team on managing and troubleshooting Azure NetApp Files.
Ensure the storage setup meets all regulatory compliance requirements. Implement regular auditing procedures to verify compliance and security postures.
Use Azure Monitor to continuously track the performance metrics of Azure NetApp Files, including latency, throughput, and IOPS. Investigate and address any anomalies.
Regularly test backup and restore processes to ensure data integrity and availability. Verify that snapshots are created and retained according to the defined policies.
Audit security settings, including encryption and access controls, to ensure compliance with organizational policies and industry standards.
Ensure that network configurations, such as virtual network peering and firewall rules, are optimized for Azure NetApp Files connectivity and security.
Analyze storage usage trends and plan for capacity upgrades to avoid disruptions due to insufficient storage space.
Perform failover tests to validate the resiliency of Azure NetApp Files in case of service disruptions. Ensure that data remains accessible during failover scenarios.
Review and adjust storage tiering and performance settings to ensure optimal performance for workloads hosted on Azure NetApp Files.
Conduct incident response drills to prepare the team for potential security incidents or service outages. Ensure familiarity with procedures and protocols.
Evaluate the SLA performance of Azure NetApp Files. Address any issues or deviations from the agreed SLA metrics.
Develop and execute plans for Azure NetApp Files upgrades or expansions as needed. Ensure minimal disruption during these activities.
Ensure the operations team participates in regular training to stay updated with new Azure NetApp Files features, best practices, and security measures.
Regularly back up configurations of Azure NetApp Files to ensure secure and accessible storage of backups for potential restoration.
Collect and analyze user feedback regarding Azure NetApp Files performance and reliability. Implement continuous improvements based on this feedback.
